function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Low-income neighborhoods have reduced greenspace availability, leading to lower use of greenspaces","Impact":"Increased risk of sedentary lifestyle, decreased access to nature, and lower opportunities for social interaction and physical activity","Mitigation":"Investing in the creation and maintenance of greenspaces in low-income neighborhoods, and promoting community engagement in using these spaces","Technologies":"Urban planning technology for the development and maintenance of greenspaces, community engagement platforms for promoting the use of greenspaces","People":"Residents of low-income neighborhoods","Owner":"Urban planners, community organizations"},{"Description":"Park quality and frequency of park use are higher among high-socioeconomic status (SES) residents","Impact":"Exacerbation of health inequalities, unequal access to health-promoting environments, and limited social interaction across different socioeconomic groups","Mitigation":"Improving the quality of parks in low-income neighborhoods, implementing inclusive programming to encourage park use by all socioeconomic groups, and providing transportation to parks for residents in low-income neighborhoods","Technologies":"Smart park management systems for monitoring park quality, transportation systems for improving access to parks, and data analytics for identifying areas with low park use","People":"Residents of low-income neighborhoods, high-SES residents","Owner":"Park management authorities, local government, community organizations"},{"Description":"Living in a greener neighborhood is linked with stronger greenspace-health associations and lower income-related health inequalities","Impact":"Unequal distribution of health benefits and increased health disparities between neighborhoods with varying greenspace availability","Mitigation":"Equitable distribution of greenspaces across neighborhoods, ensuring accessibility and affordability of greenspace amenities for all residents, and promoting the health benefits of greenspaces through community education","Technologies":"Geospatial mapping for identifying areas with low greenspace, telehealth platforms for promoting health benefits, and community engagement technologies for education and advocacy","People":"Residents of neighborhoods with limited greenspace, public health organizations","Owner":"Urban planners, local government, public health organizations"}]}
